title: Portfolio Website
description: A modern portfolio website built with Next.js and Tailwind CSS

body.raw:
# Portfolio Website This is my personal portfolio website built with Next.js, Tailwind CSS, and TypeScript. It features a responsive design, dark mode, and content management with MDX and Contentlayer. ## Features - **Modern Tech Stack**: Built with Next.js, React, and TypeScript - **Responsive Design**: Looks great on all devices - **Dark Mode**: Toggle between light and dark themes - **Content Management**: Easy to update with MDX and Contentlayer - **Performance Optimized**: Fast loading times and optimized images - **SEO Friendly**: Proper metadata and structured data ## Development Process I started by planning the structure and design of the website. I wanted a clean, minimalist design that would showcase my projects and skills effectively. I chose Next.js for its excellent performance and developer experience. For styling, I used Tailwind CSS with the shadcn/ui component library. This allowed me to create a consistent design system while maintaining flexibility. ## Challenges and Solutions One of the challenges I faced was implementing the dark mode toggle. I solved this by using the next-themes library, which provides a simple way to manage themes in Next.js applications. Another challenge was creating a content management system that would allow me to easily update my projects and blog posts. I solved this by using Contentlayer, which transforms my MDX files into type-safe content objects. ```typescript // Example of a component from the project function ProjectCard({ project }) { return (

{project.title}

{project.description}

{project.tags.map((tag) => ( {tag} ))}
); } ``` ## Conclusion Building this portfolio was a great learning experience. I was able to practice my skills in React, Next.js, and Tailwind CSS while creating a platform to showcase my work.
